intro: Heliophila elata subsp. pillansii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-like inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
